cluster_classes.class_description: Nested geographic areas that represent the spatial extent over which phenomena such as legends can spread.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Urban legends spread across regions and continents, taking on new forms and variations.

members.entity_description: Geographic areas across which urban legends spread.
Large landmasses representing broad geographic spread of legends.

cluster_classes.class_description: Concepts describing how urban legends function and evolve in society, including their impact, persistence, and modes of circulation.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Origins of urban legends, their impact on society, why they endure, and how they spread.

members.entity_name: impact of urban legends on society
members.entity_description: The influence that urban legends have on social attitudes, beliefs, and behaviors.
The continued persistence and survival of urban legends over time.
The dissemination and circulation of urban legend stories through society.

cluster_classes.class_description: Abstract social constructs describing the shared environment and mental space of a society, particularly as they relate to the persistence of narratives like urban legends.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Urban legends thrive within modern society and the collective imagination of society.

members.entity_description: Contemporary social context in which urban legends are prevalent.
Shared mental space and creativity of a society where urban legends persist.

cluster_classes.class_description: Social groups, cultural environments, and global scopes that form the audience and context in which urban legends circulate and gain influence.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Groups and mainstream culture where urban legends circulate and spread around the world to a global audience.

members.entity_description: Groups of people, both large and small, that share and retell urban legends as a means of social cohesion and mutual protection.
Mainstream cultural environment where widely shared stories, media, and urban legends circulate and exert influence.
Societies linked through trade and travel, enabling wider spread of legends.
Worldwide population that can receive urban legend stories almost instantaneously online.
Global scope over which the Hook Man legend is told.

cluster_classes.class_description: Groups of people, from broad cultures to close loved ones, that shape or are protected by the sharing of legends and stories.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Different cultures and loved ones whose interests, fears, and protection are tied to shared tales.

members.entity_description: Different cultural groups whose interests and fears shape story variations.
Family members or close associates whom communities aim to protect by sharing legends.

cluster_classes.class_description: Historical and modern eras referenced to contextualize the development and spread of urban legends, from ancient storytelling to the internet and social media age.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: The spread of urban legends has been facilitated in the age of the internet... traced back to ancient times when stories were used to explain the unknown.

members.entity_name: age of the internet and social media
members.entity_description: Modern era characterized by pervasive internet access and widespread social media platforms.
Historical period referenced as the origin era for explanatory stories and legends.

args.justification: "the world" is a geographic scope/location and fits better with other spatial extents (regions, continents) than with social/audience contexts.

args.new_name: Geographic Scales of Urban Legend Spread
args.new_description: Nested geographic areas (regions, continents, the world) that represent the spatial extent over which urban legends can spread.
args.justification: Clarifies that this class covers spatial scales of urban legend diffusion and aligns it within a shared context group for urban legend-related settings.

args.new_description: Concepts describing how urban legends function and evolve in society, including their impact, persistence, and modes of circulation.
args.justification: Keeps the existing, accurate label/description while connecting this class to the broader urban-legend context group shared with related classes.

args.new_description: Abstract social constructs describing the shared environment and mental space of a society, particularly as they relate to the persistence and interpretation of urban legends.
args.justification: Refines the description to explicitly reference urban legends and aligns this societal-context class with the common urban legend context group.

args.new_description: Social groups, cultural environments, and audience scopes that form the contexts in which urban legends circulate and gain influence.
args.justification: Removes the purely geographic member to keep this class focused on social/audience contexts and connects it to the shared urban legend context group.

args.new_name: Community Social Groups in Urban Legends
args.new_description: Groups of people, from broad cultures to close loved ones, that shape, transmit, or are protected by the sharing of urban legends and related stories.
args.justification: Clarifies that this class is about the social groups themselves (rather than abstract contexts) and unifies it under the same urban legend context group.

args.new_description: Historical and modern eras used to contextualize the development and spread of urban legends, from ancient storytelling to the internet and social media age.
args.justification: Keeps an accurate temporal focus while explicitly linking this class into the unified context group for urban legend-related settings.

executed_decisions.justification: "the world" is a geographic scope/location and fits better with other spatial extents (regions, continents) than with social/audience contexts.
